abstract: Prosecutors in murder trial of Angelika Graswald for death of her fiance Vincent Viafore in Hudson River face challenge of lack of physical evidence linking her to crime, and are mostly relying on oral and written statements she made; Graswald enters plea of not guilty to charges of second-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter at arraignment.
lead_paragraph: Legal experts say the incriminating statements from Angelika Graswald, who is accused of killing her fiancé, are both the case’s greatest strength and its weakness.

headline.main: Physical Evidence Scant, Focus Is on Statements in Kayak Case
headline.print_headline: Physical Evidence Scant, Focus Is on Statements in Kayak Case

snippet: Legal experts say the incriminating statements from Angelika Graswald, who is accused of killing her fiancé, are both the case’s greatest strength and its weakness.
